On [[4 January]] [[1968]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"
thumb]]: a letter]] to Ken Jackson'''.<ref name=CG>{{CG
column6: articlename=JRR Tolkien 2 signed letters 1968 Handwritten & Typed
column9: accessed=30 March 2014}}</ref>, that was a biology master at New College School.

*'''Subject:''' In 1967, Humphrey Carpenter produced a [[The Hobbit (1967 stage adaptation)
thumb]]: stage adaptation of ''The Hobbit'']]. Tolkien provided autographs for the actors but had neglected the technical crew. In response to this situation, Tolkien wrote a letter to the technical director enclosing "some stick-in autographs" and apologises to "the back-room boys of the drama" noting their "necessary, indeed very important, functions". He explains that his eldest son "used to perform the same functions at his school".<ref name=TL/>

*'''Descrition:''' Handwritten, two pages, on blindstamped headed paper.<ref name=TL/>
*'''Publication:''' The letter is described in ''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide
thumb]]: The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide: Chronology]]''.<ref name=CG/>
